projectDesc: Trukmu (link: trukmu.com) is the official web platform for PT. Sriwijaya Lintas Nusantara, a leading expedition and logistics company. The project was designed to modernize their customer-facing services by providing a fast, reliable, and user-friendly way for users to calculate shipping rates and access information about their expedition services.
challanges: A key challenge was translating the complex business logic of shipping rate calculations, with its many variables like origin, destination, and weight, into a simple and intuitive user interface. To overcome this, I focused on designing a clean, step-by-step user flow. By breaking down the complex form into manageable parts, this approach guides the user through the process effortlessly and significantly improves the overall user experience.
responsibilities:
As the sole Frontend Developer on this project, I was responsible for the entire client-side experience, from initial design to final implementation.

  • End-to-End Frontend Development
    Led the complete development of the user interface from scratch using Nuxt.js, ensuring a performant and scalable application.
  • UI/UX Design & Implementation
    Designed the user interface and experience with a focus on simplicity and clarity, then translated the designs into pixel-perfect, responsive code using TailwindCSS.
  • API Integration
    Collaborated closely with the backend team to define API endpoints and seamlessly integrated the frontend with backend services to fetch and display dynamic data for shipping rates, locations, and services.
  • Component-Based Architecture
    Built a library of reusable Vue.js components to maintain a consistent design system and accelerate development speed.
  • Cross-Browser Compatibility & Responsiveness
    Ensured the application provides a seamless and consistent experience across all modern browsers and devices, from mobile phones to desktops.

projectDesc: Adaboard (link: adaboard.id) is the foundational web presence for a new software house initiative, envisioned as a subsidiary of my current company. The website's primary goal is to establish a strong and professional brand identity, create a compelling digital front door to attract potential clients, and clearly showcase its vision and future services.
challanges: The main challenge was to build a complete digital identity for a new brand from scratch. I solved this by designing a modern UI/UX and implementing it on a server-rendered site using Nuxt.js, strategically chosen for its lightning-fast performance and long-term scalability for future complex features.
responsibilities:
As the sole Frontend Developer, I was entrusted with the entire process of bringing adaboard.id to life, from conceptual design to a fully functional, deployed website.

  • End-to-End Frontend Ownership
    I led the project from the initial UI/UX design phase to the final implementation, taking full ownership of the user-facing experience.
  • Brand-Centric UI/UX Design
    I designed the complete user interface with a focus on creating a modern, clean, and professional aesthetic that reflects the innovative identity of a technology company.
  • Development from Scratch
    I built the entire website using Nuxt.js and styled it with TailwindCSS, developing a suite of custom, reusable components for key sections like services, portfolio showcases, etc.
  • Performance & SEO Optimization
    I implemented frontend best practices to ensure exceptionally fast loading times (targeting high Core Web Vitals scores) and built a strong, semantic foundation for future SEO strategies by leveraging Nuxt.js's features.
  • Interactive User Experience
    I integrated subtle animations and micro-interactions to enhance user engagement and create a polished, dynamic browsing experience that encourages exploration.
